details.title: Determination of lead in nickel nitrate by flow injection with an atomic absorption spectrophotometer
details.abstract: The crown ether dicyclohexano-18-crown-6(DCH18C6) Levextrel resin was investigated as the material in miniature columns to preseparate and preconcentrate the flow injection for an atomic absorption spectrophotometer. The optimal conditions for determining the lead content in nickel nitrate were found by the homogeneous design method. These conditions improved the sensitivity, the detection limit and eliminate interference. The sensitivity by the FIA-FAAS flame atomic absorption spectrophotometry was increased 76 times than that of the FAAS and the detection limit by the FIA-FAAS was reduced 50 times than that of the FAAS. The precision of the FIA-FAAS is as good as FAAS method.
